intro: Argentina leuconota, commonly known as the Argentine leuconota, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow to brown flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in open grasslands and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
